intro: Hyacinthella pallens, commonly known as the white hyacinth or the pale hyacinth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil. It blooms in early spring and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Hyacinthella pallens is relatively hardy and can thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
